etymologies: from Latin indictio(n-), from the verb indicere (see indict)

definitions: a fiscal period of fifteen years used as a means of dating events and transactions in the Roman Empire and in the papal and some royal courts. The system was instituted by the Emperor Constantine in AD 313 and was used until the 16th century in some places.
shortDefinitions: fiscal period of fifteen years used as means of dating events and transactions in Roman Empire and in papal

definitions: a particular year in an indiction period.
